items.title: [QoI] Handle out of order arguments by reordering them
items.body:
Change handling of out of order arguments to reorder all arguments according to the parameter order instead of just performing one swap.

I'm not sure if this change is in the spirit of the original `outOfOrderArgument` method or not and if it's what @dabrahams had in mind for SR-4715 or not. 

As I see it, the new diagnostic message is more general - for better and worse - but the fix-it can rearrange multiple arguments at once. In many of the existing test cases where there are only two arguments that need to be swapped this new can be a step back in terms of clarity. At the same time I find that seeing listing all the arguments can provide additional context.

As for the fix-it; in simple cases it's likely unnecessary to modify all of the arguments, but it allows this changed code to deal with many arguments that are completely out of order.

<!-- If this pull request resolves any bugs in the Swift bug tracker, provide a link: -->
Resolves [SR-4715](https://bugs.swift.org/browse/SR-4715)

<!--
Before merging this pull request, you must run the Swift continuous integration tests.

items.title: [4.0] [Exclusivity] Fix unreachable when diagnosing on BoundGenericStructType
items.body:
Fix an unreachable when constructing the description of the accessed subpath
when diagnosing an exclusivity violation on a variable of
BoundGenericStructType.

rdar://problem/33031311

items.title: [4.0 6/23] Disable an unnecessary assert in AccessSummaryAnalysis.
items.body:
I’m totally disabling this assert in 4.0. Tracking down a compiler crash for
each obscure case of missing access marker is not a good use of time since we’re
not actually fixing these cases when we find them anyway. Instead, post 4.0, we
will catch all of these missing cases by implementing strong SIL
verification. Much more SILGen work is really required to fully implement
exclusivity diagnostics. SIL verification will be necessary to drive that.

Fixes <rdar://problem/33024357> AccessSummaryAnalysis assert "Unrecognized
argument use" building source compatibility siesta project.

4.0 PR: https://github.com/apple/swift/pull/10668

items.title: [QoI] Emit shadowing diagnostics even if argument types do not much completely
items.body:
Relax restriction placed on the function shadowing diagnostics
and allow such diagnostics to be emitted even when argument types
do not match expected parameter types, but use "near match" message
in that case to clarify that shadowing is not exact.

Resolves: rdar://problem/32854314

items.title: ArrayElementValuePropagation: Don’t create wrong SIL when trying to optimize ContiguousArray
items.body:
Instead just bail on ContiguousArray.

*) Explanation: This fixes a compiler crash when trying to append an array to a ContiguousArray (and not just plain Array).

*) Scope: This is a bug in ArrayElementValuePropagation and only happens in this scenario: var arr: ContiguousArray<UInt8> = []; arr += [4]

*) Jira/Radar: https://bugs.swift.org/browse/SR-5293, rdar://problem/32983212

*) Risk: Low. The fix just adds a bail-out condition

*) Testing: There is a swift-ci test

items.title: [swift-4.0-branch][stdlib] Underscoring the `countRepresentedWords`
items.body:
* Explanation: Hides the countRepresentedWords property which is not supposed to be used, allowing its removal later.
* Scope of Issue: The API was introduced in Beta 1, so the change is non-breaking
* Risk: Minimal
* Reviewed By: Ben Cohen
* Testing: Automated test suite
* Directions for QA: N/A
* Radar: <rdar://problem/32924828>

items.title: Demangler: refactoring: use qualified declarations for some utility functions
items.body: NFC

items.title: JSONEncoder data encoding strategy tweaks
items.body:
**What's new in this pull request?**
As laid out in a [proposed update to SE-0166 and SE-0167](https://lists.swift.org/pipermail/swift-evolution/Week-of-Mon-20170619/037672.html), there are JSON data encoding strategies that we wanted to update:

* Add `deferredToData` strategy on encode and decode
* Rename `base64{Encode,Decode}` to `base64` (missed this in previous fixes)
* Add unit test to confirm behavior

items.title: [4.0] [QoI] Emit shadowing diagnostics even if argument types do not much completely
items.body:
* Description: Relax restriction placed on the function shadowing diagnostics
                        and allow such diagnostics to be emitted even when argument types
                        do not match expected parameter types, but use "near match" message
                        in that case to clarify that shadowing is not exact.


* Scope of the issue: diagnostic improvements for function shadowing.

* Risk: Low.

* Tested: New test cases added, Swift CI.

* Reviewed by: Mark Lacey, Jordan Rose.

* Resolves: rdar://problem/32854314

(cherry picked from commit ef55d42334339fdff51a7eb79d54f9ec5bb13e0d)

items.title: [4.0] Revert "Use clang's effective llvm triple for IR generation (#10211)"
items.body:
This reverts commit 6c9977d34e85f445dfdb657df62a3bb20add3c03.

WatchOS debugging is broken due to this change. It seems the jit does not like
thumb relocations ...

rdar://32986409

items.title: EncodingError/DecodingError bridging fixes and conveniences
items.body:
**What's in this pull request?**
As laid out in a [proposed update to SE-0166 and SE-0167](https://lists.swift.org/pipermail/swift-evolution/Week-of-Mon-20170619/037672.html), there are `EncodingError`/`DecodingError` updates that we wanted to introduce to the Codable API. This implements the remainder of those updates which had not yet been implemented:

* `underlyingError` exposition on `EncodingError` and `DecodingError`
* `.dataCorrupted` conveniences for user code
* Fixing error bridging to `NSError`

This subsumes #10674.

thumb relocations ...

items.title: [Foundation] slices of slices that use range expressions incorrectly calculated relative indexing
items.body:
The RangeExpression variants of slicing incorrectly passed 0..<R.Bounds.max which should be the slice region of the Data.

This resolves the issues:
rdar://problem/32982494
rdar://problem/32983214 aka [SR-5292]: Another Data slice-related crash


Explanation:
The RangeExpression variants of slicing incorrectly passed 0..<R.Bounds.max which should be the slice region of the Data.

Scope:
This is validation of expectations of regions and appropriate slicing behavior for Data at runtime. No compile time or API changes were made here

Origination:
Feedback provided via radars (and the original version of the proposal had this behavior as well…)

Radar (and possibly SR Issue):
rdar://problem/32982494
rdar://problem/32983214 aka [SR-5292]: Another Data slice-related crash

Risk:
This does have the risk involved that it may catch inappropriate behavior in assertion enabled builds

Testing:
Additional unit tests were added and passed on master

items.title: [Type checker] Always compute protocol requirement signature first.
items.body:
The protocol requirement signature is key to conformance access paths
and other queries related to protocols. Make sure we create it first. Fix a couple of crashers along the way.

items.title: Demangler: handle suffixes in the form '.<n>'.
items.body:
Demangle such suffixes as "unmangled suffix"
IRGen still uses '.<n>' to disambiguate partial apply thunks and outlined copy functions.

*) Explanation: This enables demangling of symbol name which have a '.<n>' suffix

*) Scope: Such functions can appear in the lldb backtrace and will now be correctly demangled.

*) Radar: rdar://problem/32934962

*) Risk: Low. It's an extension to the demangler and does not affect the compiler

*) Testing: There is a swift-ci test

items.title: [NFC] Remove some uses of setLet
items.body: This patch anticipates a larger patch that removes `setLet` in addition to expanding the role of the specifier bit(s) in `ParamDecl` and `VarDecl`.  For now, it just touches a more delicate case in pattern emission specifically.  The remaining uses are to unset `let` from parameters with an `inout` specifier and will be handled later.

items.title: [4.0] JSONEncoder data encoding strategy tweaks
items.body:
**What's new in this pull request?**
Cherry-picks #10680 to `swift-4.0-branch`.

**Explanation:**
As laid out in a [proposed update to SE-0166 and SE-0167](https://lists.swift.org/pipermail/swift-evolution/Week-of-Mon-20170619/037672.html), there are JSON data encoding strategies that we wanted to update:

* Add `deferredToData` strategy on encode and decode
* Rename `base64{Encode,Decode}` to `base64` (missed this in previous fixes)
* Add unit test to confirm behavior

**Scope:** Affects those who want to customize the default behavior of encoding and decoding `Data` using `JSONEncoder`/`JSONDecoder`.
**Radar:** rdar://problem/32469875
**Risk:** Low
**Testing:** Adds new unit tests to confirm expected behavior.

items.title: [NFC] Use a meaningful representation of parameter specifiers
items.body:
In anticipation of future attributes, and perhaps the ability to
declare lvalues with specifiers other than 'let' and 'var', expand
the "isLet" bit into a more general "specifier" field.

items.title: [QoI] Add fix-it for cases in switch with optional chaining
items.body:
When type-checking switch statements with patterns let's
check if we have an optional type and try to see if the case
exists in its base type, if so we can suggest a fix-it.

Resolves: rdar://problem/32241441

items.title: [4.0] [Type checker] Always compute protocol requirement signature first.
items.body:
**Explanation**: The protocol requirement signature is key to conformance access paths
and other queries related to protocols; make sure we create it first. 
**Scope**: Fixes several crash-on-invalid tests found by @practicalswift 's fuzzing.
**Radar**: rdar://problem/33067393
**Risk**: Low; we're computing the same things, but prioritizing the more important one.
**Testing**: Compiler regression testing.

items.title: [4.0][Parse] Fix skipping string interpolation in Lexer
items.body:
Cherry-pick #10246 
* **Explanation**: This is a fix for `AcceptsInvalid` case in Swift4 new feature.
  * Disallow newline after multiline string in string interpolation. ([SR-5171](https://bugs.swift.org/browse/SR-5171))

    ```swift
    "abc\("""
          defg
          """ // ← This newline should be rejected.
          )hij"
    ```
  * Allow unbalanced `"` in multiline string in string interpolation.

    ```swift
    "abc\("""
          "defg ← This unbalanced quote should be accepted
          """)hij"
    ```
* **Scope**: Affects lexing multiline string in string interpolation.
* **SR Issue**: [SR-5171](https://bugs.swift.org/browse/SR-5171)
* **Risk**: Low
* **Testing**: Added regression tests

items.title: No backtrace when Ctrl-C interrupts build-script
[4.0] [QoI] Add fix-it for cases in switch with optional chaining
items.body:
* Description: When type-checking switch statements with patterns let's
                        check if we have an optional type and try to see if the case
                        exists in its base type, if so we can suggest a fix-it.

* Scope of the issue: diagnostic improvements for enum cases with optional chaining.

* Risk: Low.

* Tested: New test cases added, Swift CI.

* Reviewed by: Mark Lacey, Jordan Rose.

* Resolves: rdar://problem/32241441

(cherry picked from commit 5f571836543b12b241808f7917ef9eca56eb7e59)

items.title: [QoI] Add fixit for missing 'else' in guard statement
items.body:
I always forget to type `else` here.
```
test.swift:2:19: error: expected 'else' after 'guard' condition
  guard let x = x {
                  ^
                  else 
```

items.title: [4.0] Use the debugger hook, `reportToDebugger`, for all calls to _swift_stdlib_reportFatalError[InFile]
items.body:
Use the debugger hook, `reportToDebugger`, for all calls to _swift_stdlib_reportFatalError[InFile].  Only do this when a hidden frontend flag, `-report-errors-to-debugger`, is used. This cherry-picks 4b88da2a2cc8e8afb1f074a0287faa929d353ea6 onto swift-4.0-branch.

**Explanation**: This extends the "Runtime Issues" debugger hook to be used by most common fatal errors (unwrapping nil, out-of-bounds array access, precondition/assert failures), but hidden under a compiler flag for staging. Unless the flag is used, there's no change in behavior.
**Scope**: The change affects reporting of fatal errors in the Swift runtime and user code.  Unless the flag is used, there's no change in behavior.
**Radar**: <rdar://problem/32991793>
**Risk**: Very low: The change is hidden under a compiler flag.  Unless the flag is used, there's no change in behavior.
**Testing**:  I tested several common cases of fatal errors (unwrapping nil, out-of-bounds array access, precondition/assert failures) and made sure the message is correctly passed to LLDB.

items.title: [4.0] EncodingError/DecodingError bridging fixes and conveniences
items.body:
**What's in this pull request?**
Cherry-picks #10685 to `swift-4.0-branch`.

**Explanation:**
As laid out in a [proposed update to SE-0166 and SE-0167](https://lists.swift.org/pipermail/swift-evolution/Week-of-Mon-20170619/037672.html), there are `EncodingError`/`DecodingError` updates that we wanted to introduce to the Codable API. This implements the remainder of those updates which had not yet been implemented:

* `underlyingError` exposition on `EncodingError` and `DecodingError`
* `.dataCorrupted` conveniences for user code
* Fixing error bridging to `NSError`

**Scope:** Affects those consuming `EncodingError`/`DecodingError` and want to present those to the user in a localized way.
**Radars:**
  * rdar://problem/32405015
  * rdar://problem/32512651
  * rdar://problem/32381842
  * rdar://problem/32235068

**Risk:** Low
**Testing:** Manual verification

items.title: Improve symbolicate-linux-fatal to handle unparsable addresses.
items.body: Refactoring and improvements in symbolicate-linux-fatal. It won't now exit on unparsable addresses.
